BCC: 
Date: 2025-01-20 13:47
Subject: FW: LV Tender
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Hagop 

 

As discussed, please advise what can we comment on by Thursday in regard to LV tender noting transportation is excluded (Scope is warehousing services)

 

Offer should include “ Contracted responsibilities and insurance policies”

Insurance is mentioned on page 22 

 

 

 

DEENA ELQSOOS​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ CAPABILITY DEVELOPMENT & OPTIMISATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

From: Deena Elqsoos <Deena.Elqsoos@chalhoub.com> 
Sent: Monday, 20 January 2025 11:30 AM
To: Bhaskar Sharma <Bhaskar.Sharma@chalhoub.com>; Elmehdi Tahabouamri <Elmehdi.Tahabouamri@chalhoub.com>
Subject: FW: LV Tender

 

Hello

From: Deena Elqsoos <Deena.Elqsoos@chalhoub.com> 
Sent: Monday, 20 January 2025 11:30 AM
To: Bhaskar Sharma <Bhaskar.Sharma@chalhoub.com>; Elmehdi Tahabouamri <Elmehdi.Tahabouamri@chalhoub.com>
Subject: FW: LV Tender

 

Hello 

 

Joe will be visiting LV this Thursday to discuss Scope 1: Leasing and current facility “renovation”. The direction is not to engage in the specifics on renovation.

 

As for Scope 2 : 3PL Services. Besides submitting commercials, we are expected to:

 

1.	Sign the attached terms and conditions (which include monetary penalties)
2.	Review the attached word file contract and share our legal comments 
3.	Submit a general presentation on Chalhoub that covers:

	a.	Information on the company (worldwide and regional separately)
	b.	General presentation about Chalhoub and our services 
	c.	Group structure, revenue, no, of employees..
	d.	Financial information (turn over and global profitability, financial statements, investment strategy) 
	e.	Org chart and contacts (top management and local country teams)

4.	Share an offer that includes:

a.      Current certifications 

b.      SOPs

c.      Environmental Health and Safety roadmap

d.      Warehouse technical specification document with comments @Bhaskar Sharma <mailto:Bhaskar.Sharma@chalhoub.com> 

e.      Insurances policy and contracted responsibility 

f.        Sustainability (Renewable energy current and planned set up, CO2 reduction roadmap, Zero waste Strategy, Diversity and inclusion program)

e.      Insurances policy and contracted responsibility 

f.        Sustainability (Renewable energy current and planned set up, CO2 reduction roadmap, Zero waste Strategy, Diversity and inclusion program)

g.       Full project plan that includes (Implementation plan,timeline, project team details: experience, skills,etc), examples of implementation of the same methodology for similar projects)

 

 

DEENA ELQSOOS​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ CAPABILITY DEVELOPMENT & OPTIMISATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

CHALHOUBGROUP.COM <http://www.chalhoubgroup.com/>

From: Deena Elqsoos <Deena.Elqsoos@chalhoub.com <mailto:Deena.Elqsoos@chalhoub.com> > 
Sent: Wednesday, 15 January 2025 5:40 PM
To: Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Elmehdi Tahabouamri <Elmehdi.Tahabouamri@chalhoub.com <mailto:Elmehdi.Tahabouamri@chalhoub.com> >; Bhaskar Sharma <Bhaskar.Sharma@chalhoub.com <mailto:Bhaskar.Sharma@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: FW: LV Tender

 

Hi Joe

 

I hope all is well! 

 

LV team has requested our support to assess the potential renovations in their current leased facility regarding cost and feasibility. Below are the key points they have summarized:

I hope all is well! 

 

LV team has requested our support to assess the potential renovations in their current leased facility regarding cost and feasibility. Below are the key points they have summarized:

 

*	Extending and fitting out our current warehouse by increasing floor space.
*	Creating more storage space, in particularly to relocate stock stored in external warehouse (archives, furniture)
*	Expanding our repair centre into the previous office space.
*	Fitting out our Louis Vuitton Campus instead of current open space

 

I have also attached the documents related to their repair center and LV Learning Campus they are looking to build ideally within the same facility. 

 

Guillaume asked for someone from our “Facilities/Design” team to visit and help with the assessment as soon as possible. Please advise the best way forward. Thanks! 

 

 

DEENA ELQSOOS​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ CAPABILITY DEVELOPMENT & OPTIMISATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Dear Deena, Jerome, and Bhaskar,

 

Happy New Year on behalf of the Louis Vuitton Team!

 

We are pleased to inform you that the deadline for the RFP submission has been extended to Friday, January 17th – 6PM (Dubai Time)

Dear Deena, Jerome, and Bhaskar,

 

Happy New Year on behalf of the Louis Vuitton Team!

 

We are pleased to inform you that the deadline for the RFP submission has been extended to Friday, January 17th – 6PM (Dubai Time)

 

Additionally, please note that Vincent BARALE, our Group SVP of Supply Chain, Logistics, and Care Services, will be visiting us from Monday, January 27th, to Tuesday, January 28th.

 

We would be delighted if you could join us during his visit to our existing warehouse to review the renovation plans & different options for running our Operations (cf: aligned with the RFP proposed offer).

 

Thank you very much for your attention.

 

Regards,

 

Guillaume ANRES
Supply Chain & Distribution Manager| Louis Vuitton Middle East | Mob: +971 52 944 6800

Dear Deena, Jerome, and Bhaskar,

 

I hope you are all doing very well!

 

Thank you for last week’s meeting and the quality of our discussions.

 

Please find enclosed the consolidated Q&As received over the past few days.

Dear Deena, Jerome, and Bhaskar,

 

I hope you are all doing very well!

 

Thank you for last week’s meeting and the quality of our discussions.

 

Please find enclosed the consolidated Q&As received over the past few days. 

We are pleased to extend the submission deadline for the offer to Wednesday, January 15th instead of January 6th.

 

We are still awaiting the final confirmation regarding a potential relocation of our regional head office from Jebel Ali. 

Given this, one solid option we would like to consider is staying at our current location, which is currently under renewal discussions with between our respective Finance & Legal teams.

 

To explore this further, we would like to evaluate the feasibility of:

 

*	Extending and fitting out our current warehouse by increasing floor space.
*	Creating more storage space, in particularly to relocate stock stored in external warehouse (archives, furniture)
*	Expanding our repair centre into the previous office space.
*	Fitting out our Louis Vuitton Campus instead of current open space

 

Would it be possible to schedule a discussion with your Design and Facility teams in the coming weeks, post-Christmas, to assess what can be achieved?

 

Additionally, our Logistics & Supply Chain Vice President, Vincent Barale, will be visiting our affiliate at the end of January to review the final options for our warehouse and repair centre tender. 

We believe this would be a great opportunity for him to meet with you and review the possibilities—either in our current facility or within a different Chalhoub site in JAFZA.

Additionally, our Logistics & Supply Chain Vice President, Vincent Barale, will be visiting our affiliate at the end of January to review the final options for our warehouse and repair centre tender. 

We believe this would be a great opportunity for him to meet with you and review the possibilities—either in our current facility or within a different Chalhoub site in JAFZA.

 

Thank you very much for your support. We wish you happy holidays and remain at your disposal for any further information.

 

Best Regards,

 

Guillaume ANRES
Supply Chain & Distribution Manager| Louis Vuitton Middle East | Mob: +971 52 944 6800

guillaume.anres@louisvuitton.com <mailto:guillaume.anres@louisvuitton.com> 
Jebel Ali Free Zone, Gate 7, Roundabout 12, P.O. Box 262910, Dubai, UAE

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>

Date: 2025-01-23 13:47
Subject: RE: LV Tender
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Deena,

 

There are few points that are worth considering:

 

*	The tender makes Chalhoub responsible for all damages to the stock

	*	If this is the case, the insurance costs should be factored into the pricing. (approximately 0.3% at least of the value brought into the warehouse for storage, handling and transit)
	*	Also, not all losses can be covered, lost packages, mis-deliveries are harder to claim than clear cut car accidents for example leading to damages to the product, so I would recommend to factor in a buffer these kinds of losses as well that you may have to pay out of pocket. 

*	If LV decides to insure themselves for products, there should be a limitation of liability on Chalhoub based on weight of the products stored.
*	Allowable shrinkage is 0.005%. This is unreasonably low.

	*	Shrinkage is not covered by insurance. One LV bag lost can cancel out a good portion of your profits.

*	If LV decides to insure themselves for products, there should be a limitation of liability on Chalhoub based on weight of the products stored.
*	Allowable shrinkage is 0.005%. This is unreasonably low.

	*	Shrinkage is not covered by insurance. One LV bag lost can cancel out a good portion of your profits.

 

This is not related the insurance, but 5% productivity improvement annually is a bit in poor taste. Rents are going up and everything gets expensive, not cheaper.

 

If this is something LV will go with, we can amend the agreement as needed but these for now these are the main points to consider in relation to insurance and the liability sections.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

I hope all is well! 

 

LV team has requested our support to assess the potential renovations in their current leased facility regarding cost and feasibility. Below are the key points they have summarized:

 

*	Extending and fitting out our current warehouse by increasing floor space.
*	Creating more storage space, in particularly to relocate stock stored in external warehouse (archives, furniture)
*	Expanding our repair centre into the previous office space.
*	Fitting out our Louis Vuitton Campus instead of current open space

 

I have also attached the documents related to their repair center and LV Learning Campus they are looking to build ideally within the same facility. 

 

Guillaume asked for someone from our “Facilities/Design” team to visit and help with the assessment as soon as possible. Please advise the best way forward. Thanks!

Dear Deena, Jerome, and Bhaskar,

 

Happy New Year on behalf of the Louis Vuitton Team!

 

We are pleased to inform you that the deadline for the RFP submission has been extended to Friday, January 17th – 6PM (Dubai Time)

 

Additionally, please note that Vincent BARALE, our Group SVP of Supply Chain, Logistics, and Care Services, will be visiting us from Monday, January 27th, to Tuesday, January 28th.

 

We would be delighted if you could join us during his visit to our existing warehouse to review the renovation plans & different options for running our Operations (cf: aligned with the RFP proposed offer).

 

Thank you very much for your attention.
